item.title: Silver Carp - helping hands & new experiences
item.description: Lending a helping hand to fellow grad students is perhaps the most rewarding and enjoyable educational activities which graduate students can partake in. Benefits are two-fold. First, you gain the satisfactory feeling that comes from helping out a fellow student and friend while secondly, learning something more about a part of science and nature which heretofore you knew absolutely nothing about. And all at zero cost, no stress, and potentially some good food and comradeship.

item.title: About
item.description: Ira is a graduate research assistant in the department of Wildlife, Fisheries, and Aquaculture at Mississippi State University. Growing up on the family farm in Northeast Kansas, Ira developed a love for animals, the outdoors, and nature. He received his bachelors in Feed Science and Management from Kansas State University in 2015 before moving to Texas A&M where he did a Masters of Science in Animal Science. With a focus on improving management of natural resources, Ira is pursuing his passion, exploring the nexus between plant and animal ecology to maximize efficiency and sustainability for livestock production.
